references.paper_title: Spherical Fourier Neural Operators: Learning Stable Dynamics on the Sphere
references.reason: This paper introduces the SFNO architecture, a crucial component of the proposed Spherical DYffusion model, enabling efficient and stable long-term climate simulations.

references.paper_title: DYffusion: A dynamics-informed diffusion model for spatiotemporal forecasting
references.reason: This paper introduces the DYffusion framework, which is integrated with SFNO to create the proposed model, enabling probabilistic climate predictions with reduced computational overhead.

references.paper_title: ACE: A fast, skillful learned global atmospheric model for climate prediction
references.reason: This paper introduces the ACE model, a high-performing deterministic climate model emulator used as a baseline and key component for comparison in the proposed method's evaluation.
This foundational paper on diffusion models provides the theoretical basis for the DYffusion framework, a key component of the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Diffusion models beat GANs on image synthesis
references.reason: This influential paper demonstrates the effectiveness of diffusion models in image generation, highlighting their potential for other data modalities, including climate modeling, and serving as a foundational reference for diffusion models.
